contest-event.event-date:
July 17, 1886 D Lindley Contest
Lindley Contest 0 Own Choice Test Piece Contest
lindley-contest
None
Westgate, Lindley 3rd Annual Contest. Prizes: £20, £12, £6, £4, £2 Contest held in a field loaned by Soloman Baten. Besses and Linthwaite were asked to play their pieces again so that the judge could make his final verdict. "As soon as the Honley Band discovered that Mr. Embury was the judge they left the field, having, it is said, in consequence of disapproval of his decisions at former contests, made a vow never to contest again when he was the judge." Quickstep contest also held, - 1. Black Dyke, 2. Batley Old, 3. Leeds Forge
May 22, 2011, 5:58 p.m. May 9, 2019, 11:14 a.m.
1 Besses o' th' Barn Alexander Owen Rossini's Works / Rossini Fantasia / Reminiscences of Rossini [arr. Owen]
2 Linthwaite Silver Band George Raine L'Etoile du Nord [arr. Godfrey]
3 Black Dyke Band Alexander Owen Rossini's Works / Rossini Fantasia / Reminiscences of Rossini [arr. Owen]
4 Batley Old Benjamin Denton Jackson Recollections of Meyerbeer [unknown arranger]
5 Leeds Forge Edwin Swift Tannhäuser [arr. Swift]
Withdrawn Honley Silver Band Unknown
Withdrawn Littleborough Public Band Unknown
Withdrawn Wyke Old Unknown
